inn1.comm: finds the edge straight away with a good-length delivery but it flies short and wide of second slip who just gets a hand on it
touch fuller outside off and it draws Azhar into a drive which finds cover
back of a length outside off and Azhar shoulders arms...decent carry through to Kieswetter at about waist-height
pitched up fuller, Azhar comes onto the front foot and drives it hard into the pitch which sends it one bounce back to Finn
tight line a fraction outside off, Azhar lunges forward and defends to the covers
good pace to end the over and Azhar watches it go through outside off
starts full on off stump and it's defended towards mid-off with bat and pad close together

gone! Excellent start to Dernbach's comeback. A good length outside off and a tentative poke from Hafeez which sent a regulation catch to the keeper. No footwork to speak of from Hafeez, which has been a problem for a number of Pakistan's batsmen
good line first ball to Shafiq who lets it go outside off stump
full on middle and off, punched firmly towards mid-on
dragged down shorter and a little too wide outside off, there's a hint of swing but poses no danger to the batsman
lovely shot, good response from Shafiq as he pulls out a sweetly-timed on-drive that whistles to the boundary
on leg stump and easily flicked away through square leg
opens the face and defends towards backward point
back of a length, nips into Azhar who pushes it into the gap at midwicket and they scamper a quick single
probing away outside off, a decent stride from the batsman as he defends to cover
more movement for Finn back into the batsman as he lets this go
worked into leg-side gap at midwicket to keep the strike
driven firmly into the covers
opens the face and defends to backward point
manages to find the gap this time
good stuff from Dernbach, accurate at decent pace as the batsman defends
opens the face and guides down to third man
and it's a shot repeated by Shafiq this time as he waits for the ball outside off and runs it down to third man
worked into leg side and can't find the gap
and again can't beat the fielder as he picks out square leg with a nicely-timed flick
outside off, met with a solid defence by Shafiq
changed his stroke at the last moment, initially wanted to drive but then placed it wide of backward point
dropped square into the off side
a handsome drive with a nice follow through, but it goes straight to mid-off who is quite deep
takes the chance to free his arms, latches onto some width from Dernbach and drives on the up through the covers
pulls his line back to off stump and it's pushed towards mid-on
neatly worked away from middle stump through square leg...not quite the accuracy from Dernbach
full on middle and off, defended towards the on side
that's good from Dernbach, on off stump and makes it tough for the batsman to decide whether to play forward or back
cashes in again to make it an expensive over, overpitched on middle and leg then dispatches with a powerful flick through midwicket
on the stumps, punched square on the leg side
clipped off the pads again, this time behind square
shorter length, outside off angling in but played on the walk off his hips out to deep backward square
full, well outside off before seaming back a touch - left alone
touch full, driven to mid-off but not off the middle of the bat
length, jabbed back to the bowler who fields
outside off, seaming back a long way for Kieswetter to take diving to his left. Left by the batsman
length, in the corridor outside off, with a scrambled seam ... again ignored
room to dab the ball down to third man
too short and smashed disdainfully through cover-point! That was ruthless, Azhar stepping out to unleash hell
back of a length, drops the hands and leaves
off-stump line and defended towards cover
flicked off the hips down to long leg
angled in towards the legs, turned round the corner
length ball outside off, pushed to point on the front foot
off-stump line, defended pushing forward
length and Shafiq tries to drive on the up, doesn't get hold of it as the bat turns in the hands and Finn fields
immaculate line and length and defended square on the off side
short, tucking the batsman up but they hustle through for one as midwicket misses when a direct hit would have removed Shafiq
back of a length again, pulled powerfull but not quite off the middle
off-stump line, deflected to third man
still too short and wide, Azhar dances out of his crease and slaps Bresnan through point again. Top shot
tighterline but guided down to third man
on the stumps, worked short on the leg side, good running again
off-stump line, nudged to slip on the bounce
on the legs, runs away to short fine leg
on the stumps, flat-ish, pushed to point
on the stumps and hit in front - was there bat? Briggs appeals and the ball runs into the gap square
tossed up a little more and driven to extra-cover
tight line, turned to square leg. A very solid first over in international cricket from Briggs
back of a length, chopped to short third man off the back foot
angled across, down leg ... Kieswetter appeals enthusiastically for caught behind, looking a bit of a goon for his efforts. Looks like it brushed the thigh pad
nurdled into a leg-side gap off the stumps
outside off, slower ball and guided - almost caressed - to third man
still a bit loose from Bresnan, Azhar steps out and pushes behind point with soft hands
off-stump line, dabbed to third man
on the pads and tickled to short fine leg
leg-stump line again and glanced very fine, beating the dive on the boundary
tossed up on off this time, defended on the front foot
flighted, driven into the ground from in front of the stumps back to the bowler
full, straight, can't get him away again
tossed up and again fielded by the bowler, who has a little dart as if to try and throw down the stumps ... good response from Briggs
tickled down to long-on
on the stumps, turned to the man at square leg
some turn for Pietersen, beating the bat down the leg side, with Kieswetter attempting a cheeky stumping
on the stumps, played off the back foot back down the wicket
tossed up on leg, swept square down on one knee
flatter, nudged off the pads to square leg
big turn, off a length outside off, and flicked off the pads again
tight on off, chopped off the back foot to short third man
tossed up wide of leg stump
full, driven through Jos Buttler at extra-cover, who completely misses the ball
defended into the off side
driven to cover
on off, a touch short and expertly flipped over his shoulder by Azhar. This is not how he bats in Test cricket ...
tossed up, worked out to cover
room outside off, driven square and just out of reach of Cook's dive at point
tossed up and Shafiq's skips out to pummel the ball wristily over midwicket!
on the stumps, defended
tight line from Patel but Shafiq drops him into the off side and they run hard again
turned off the legs out to deep backward square
tossed up, driven back to the bowler
on the stumps, defended on the back foot
wide, top-edged cut and comfortably beats the fielder running round from third man
wide, slapped hard to point
full, straight, driven back to the bowler, Dernbach fielding with his heels even as he hopped out of the way ...
slower ball - one of Dernbach's many - and flipped to long leg
on the stumps, dropped to short midwicket
drags it down as the batsman advances, defended into the off side
taken from outside off and clipped down to long-on
on the stumps, dropped short into the on side and quickly run again
tossed up, prodded back to the bowler
length, on the stumps, worked away square
again spots the batsman leaving his crease, drops short and defended on the walk
bouncer, hooked via the bottom edge but doesn't get it off the square
cut hard but superbly fielded at point by Morgan
outside off, deflected off the back foot to third man
short, wide and upper-cut over point, Briggs coming round to field in the deep
Dernbach strays down the leg side this time and Shafiq flicks him calmly off his pads for a boundary that take him to an excellent fifty - his sixth in ODIs
on the stumps this time, defended back down the wicket
length, outside off, cut off the back foot out to the cover sweeper
on the pads, tickled square
driven to mid-off
tossed up, defended on the front foot
tight line again and prodded short of cover, a run declined
room to cut and Shafiq rocks back at swishes away
late cut past backward point and a chase on for third man, does well, slides and saves
length on off stump and blocked
little bit of width again and this is late cut once more, this time very fine and no chance for third man
angled in to off stump, much better, blocked from the crease
angled into off stump again and dropped out to point
fuller on off stump and draws the man forward, again blocked to point
full just outside off and wristily flicked to long off
off stump and played late to backward point
flighted up on middle stump and Shafiq down low to paddle sweep towards the fine leg fence
a little shorter and cut out to deep point
fuller and punched back to the bowler
floated up on off stump and driven down to long off
dropped down to third man
length on off stump and tucked to cover with a shuffle from the crease
off stump and the batsman across his stumps to push into the leg side
off stump and pushed off the back foot into the off side

chopped it on trying to cut a ball that was angled in to the right-hander and the shot that had served Shafiq rather well becomes his downfall. It was on a length and Shafiq tried to stand in the crease and chop it down to third man but it just came back in a touch to take the bottom edge onto the stumps
off stump on a length and blocked
full length and played back, nudged to point
full, a skip down and a drive to long off
off stump and pushed forward to extra cover
down the pitch and a hack to mid on because he didn't get to the pitch
swept very fine with a paddle sweep off middle and off, they come back for three
down the pitch, dragged down and pushed back to the bowler
length on off stump and played back towards the bowler
full and a little bit of in-drift, left alone
back of a length, dropped into the off side and they take a quick run
full and just outside off stump, dropped to point
little bit more width and dabbed down to third man
played with the angle through square leg off the back foot
tossed up on off stump, draws the batsman forward to block to point
goes for the reverse paddle, strikes the...um...pad? Cry for leg before from Kieswetter turned down
reverse sweep connects this time to short third man
turned off middle stump through square leg
down the pitch and driven hard to short extra cover
step down again and nudged into the leg side, they refuse the run
full on off stump and pushed back to the bowler
driven to point
played from the crease and flicked out towards deep point
length and driven to short extra cover
full on middle and driven to long on, Patel just watches it trundle past him
driven out to deep cover
flighted up and driven down to long off
step down, Briggs sees him coming, well bowled, dragged down and blocked on the move
turned off the inside edge to short long leg, good running
turned away from a full length on middle stump through square leg
flatter on the off stump and blocked
middle and leg and pushed into the leg side
tossed up and driven back to the bowler from off stump
fired in on off stump and blocked
forward defence on off stump
pushed into the leg side
flicked through the off side
shot, flashed away past extra cover and that'll run away from Bresnan for four
skip down and drive to long off
step away and cut out to deep cover
touch shorter and flicked to short third man
forward on off stump and pushed out to extra cover
full on middle and leg, pushed down to long on

down the pitch, in the air, he hasn't caught this properly and holed out to long off. Didn't get to the pitch, still tried to lift the ball over the fence and paid the penalty, a simple chance for Dernbach coming in a couple of yards from the fence
driven to extra cover
pushed into midwicket from a length, they turn down the run
a touch fuller and driven down to long on
full on off stump and blocked
played back and turned to mid on
pushed back to the bowler
length just outside off, opened the face to third man
length and left outside off
blocked from back of a length to point
dropped into the leg side from back of a length
full outside off and Ali plays a very awkward shot going low and trying to carve to third man, gets beaten
length and flicked down to long leg
full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
full and driven down to long off
flicked out to deep cover
full and driven down to long off
skip down and push to long on

length, an outside egde and caught at point. A fine, diving take from Morgan to his right, bagging the chance with both hands. It was a length ball which he tried to turn to leg but got a leading edge that looped low to point
back of a length and cut into the off side
length outside off and left alone
left alone again outside off
defended off the back foot
good shot to get off the mark, back foot driving past backward point and excellent work from Briggs at third man saves for
tossed up on off stump and driven to long on
hangs back and punches down to long off
length and whipped down to long on
outside off, a loose one, and chopped out to deep point
full outside off and driven to long off
down the pitch and held back, Malik not to the pitch, kick it away into the off side
straight, full, driven down the long-on
short, hooked into the ground on the leg side
back of a length on off, defended with a straight bat
slower, outside off and nudged short to cover for a quick one
well-directed bumper, neatly dropped into the off side. More good running from these two
Misbah skitters around his crease, eventually rolling his wrists on a back-of-a-length ball outside off and working it into the gap at square leg
down the leg side - but not called wide
length, touch outside off, deflected down to third man
on the stumps, worked to short midwicket
length ball on off, squirted away to deep backward square
bouncer, outside off and drawing Misbah across - defended on to the wicket and fielded by the bowler
line and length again, clipped from off stump to the fielder at midwicket
outside off, punched to cover
tossed up, well down the leg side
tossed up but Misbah is able to stand and deliver, heaving the ball over midwicket ... That's Pakistan's first boundary in 50 deliveries
off-stump line, played to extra-cover
on the stumps, back to the bowler
off-stump, chopped to mid-off
tossed up and driven hard wide of mid-off for a couple
short, pulled through square leg
fuller length, outside off and punched back to the bowler
outside off, Malik goes back and angles down to third man
off-stump, spearing in, chopped off the back foot to backward point
turned off the legs to deep backward square, run hard
drops short, tucked neatly off the hips and the fielder has to hump round to long leg
dropped short of point and they scurry through, despite Morgan's direct hit
on the stumps, driven to midwicket
wide of off and Malik swipes hard, bottom-edging into the ground
directed down the leg side, shovelled out to deep backward square - good diving stop on the boundary
length, chopped to third man
down the track, turned to short fine leg
angled in, bit of reverse swing deceives Malik, who is hit on the wrist amid stifled appeals
wide and slashed at aggressively, the ball whizzing aerially behind point
drops short, pulled square
outside off and guided down to third man
length, on the stumps, and Misbah gets forward to drive wristily down to long-on
full ball, whipped from off stump through midwicket, reeled in by the sweeper coming round
on the stumps, nurdled back
tossed up, clipped towards square leg
flighted, on off stump, driven to long-off
tossed up again, on the stumps, clipped to midwicket
steered wide of midwicket this time
on leg, goes back and brings the bat down sharply to effect a sort of standing sweep behind square
tossed up outside off and late cut for a couple
on the stumps, patted down towards long-on
given some air, driven back and deflected past the non-striker's wicket by the bowler's hand
chopped of the back foot to midwicket
length ball but Misbah narrows the distance and battenburgs a slog over deep midwicket. Doesn't bat an eyelid while doing it, either
back into his shell, defended on off
on the stumps, shovelled past extra-cover
on the stumps, deflected to square leg

another scalp for the debutant! He gave this one a little more air and Malik missed with a full-blooded sweep, the ball thumping into his back leg right in front of off stump. Classic left-arm spinner's wicket to cap a tidy performance from the new boy
pitched up, outside off, driven down the ground
on the stumps, punched to long-on
floated up and Afridi opens the shoulder but can only drive a bump ball back to the bowler. So, Briggs ends with 2 for 39 - fine figures
on the stumps, defended into the off side
straight again, punched back to the bowler
bit of room outside off and Misbah swings away down to third man
length and Afridi goes hard at it, thick-edging fine, with third man coming round
pushed to point as the batsman came forward
slightly wide and Afridi swings like he's in a children's playground, his bottom hand coming off the bat, the ball scooching out to deep backward point
slow ball, cutting his fingers over it and Afridi misses with a dab on off stump
picks this one, however, and drives on the up, straight back over the bowler's head, couple of bounces to the rope
length ball, misses with a swipe outside off
length, on off, driven to extra-cover
spots the batsman shuffle across and lets this one go out the back of the hand - Misbah prods tentatively
tossed up on leg, back of the hand again, patted square for one
length, on the stumps, clipped to deep square leg

fantastic catch from Bresnan! It was slightly short of a length and Afridi pulled hard but flat through the air, the ball dying on Bresnan as he came in from the deep midwicket boundary but he flung himself forward to take a catch Samit Patel Jonty Rhodes would have been proud of!
length, squeezed to short fine leg
on leg, nurdled off the pads
length, outside off and jabbed down to third man
back of a length, seaming in, cut from close to the body

at last, a comedy run-out! Adnan was far to quick for his own good, scurrying through for one after Misbah's flick to midwicket and then getting halfway down the wicket before realising his partner had declined to take on Samit Patel's arm in pursuit of a second. Adnan is then given a scolding by his captain as he walks off forlornly
room outside off, chopped into the ground
dropped! Cook legged it round from long-off but couldn't quite get under a top-edged pull
driven out to cover
on the stumps, worked to backward square
room outside off, dabbled to third man
full, tempting and edged through second slip. See, I said he was a run machine
length but picked up early and swung away over square leg! See, I said etc and so on
and that's the result! He dropped shorted, targetting Rehman's body, and the batsman could only scoop it to the backward square-leg fielder inside the circle
straight and completely missed by Ajmal, who spins on his axis like a top
pitched up, driven to long-on
length ball, played off the back foot to point
slower delivery, deucing Misbah's drive outside off
dropped by Pietersen at wide long-off! Misbah gave it some tap but not enough, saved only by KP's butter fingers as he dived forwards
wide and slow but missed - the batsmen run anyway
no more lives for Misbah - this time he slogs a length ball to deep midwicket and Trott, the man underneath, makes no mistake
ooh, he's crafty is Dernbach, tossing in another teaser that Ajmal tries to mow over midwicket but misses entirely, the ball skipping just past leg stump
that'll do it, full and straight and Ajmal has his stumps rearranged. Dernbach finishes with four wickets and it's been something of a comeback for England in the second half of the innings

inn2.comm: short, wide and smashed to the point boundary, hell of start, real loosener from Khan

but this is better, fired into leg stump, crashed against the pad, huge cry for lbw, turned down, it was full and looked pretty straight, hitting Cook low on the pad, they review and three reds, Cook's amazing run of form comes to an end courtesy of a fabulous delivery that's done the England captain for pace
full but too wide outside off and called
off stump, back and across and blocked
wide of off stump again and left
driven into the covers, can't beat point
forward and angled the face to guide it backward of point but again no run
dance down and tucked into the leg side past short leg
tossed up on off stump and blocked
slides on to leg stump, strikes the pad, cry for leg before, given not out by the umpire that at a quick glance looks a little like Allen Stanford
played back and punched to long on
defended from the crease on middle and leg
down the pitch again and tucked into the leg side
wide of off stump, driven lavishly, off a wide outside edge and in the air but down to third man
forward to a full ball just outside off stump, pushed to mid off
lovely stroke, a very Trott drive just waiting for it to come on and timed away through cover point
just back of a length on middle and leg, covered up into the leg side
fuller on middle and off from round the wicket, squeezed into the leg side
taken off a length and whipped into the leg side, a good save down low saves any runs at midwicket
length and Trott goes back and tries to push into the leg side, midwicket intervenes
timed through midwicket for four, a little bit across the line but punched away past the fielders and it races to the rope
length on off stump and driven to extra cover
pushed down to long on
off stump and Pietersen well forward to block
premeditated sweep, paddled down to deep backward square
length and played from the crease, edged into the leg side
length outside off, Pietersen up on his toes and pushed to extra cover
outside off and whipped down to third man off the outside half of the bat on the front foot
bumper, a good one too, and well ducked
slower ball, played forward on off stump, outside edge, on the ground to slip
back of a length, angled into the leg side
excellent stroke, down the pitch and slapped over mid off, right to the pitch and very well timed
back of a length outside off, cut hard to point
down the pitch again, off the pad, runs into the off side as Pietersen tries to play to leg
length and blocked
back of a length, cut to extra cover
length on leg stump, pushed into the leg side
short and pulled to mid on
back of a length again and back foot driven to the bowler
length on off stump, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
tucked into the leg side off a back of a length, sharp single just wide of mid on
low full toss on off stump but just pushed to cover
slower ball outside off and defended forward
full on off stump and driven away wonderfully well past extra cover, expertly placed
short and leg side, awful in fact, missed by Pietersen, off the keeper's gloves for a run as well as the wide
leg stump and pushed out through square leg
full on leg stump and pushed out through square leg
length and tucked to midwicket from the crease
leg stump again and clipped to midwicket
fabulous stroke, up on his toes and flicked away through midwicket, not timed well enough to get it to the rope though
length and pushed to mid on
full on off stump, pushed to midwicket off the front foot
defended on off stump, slower and blocked
that is awesome, a length ball on middle and off, and whipped away with sublime timing past midwicket for four! Remarkable batting, that was a joy to watch
forward and pushed forward into the off side
full on middle stump, Trott hangs back and pushes into the leg side
leg side, runs off the pad
length on off stump and pushed back to the bowler
leg stump and pushed to midwicket off the front foot
leg stump and clipped in front of the 45
full on off stump and smashed away through extra cover, another lovely stroke from Pietersen
length and punched off the back foot down to long on
length on middle stump and played back to the bowler
down the pitch and pushed out into the covers
defended carefully from the crease to a length ball, tried to find a way to manoeuvre it away
long lean forward and block on middle and off
back and clipped out to the cover fence
tossed up on middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler
floated up again, on middle stump and blocked back to the bowler
more leg stump and Pietersen goes back and pushes into the leg side
length outside off and pushed out to deep cover
goggly on off stump, defended on off stump
fuller on leg stump and clipped out to long on

gone top-edging a pull to midwicket where Hafeez comes round a takes a simple catch. It wasn't short enough to pull and Trott tried to short-arm jab it round the corner but got a top edge straight up in the air
floated up outside off, driven out through extra cover, good start for Morgan
off stump and tucked into the leg side coming forward
a touch shorter and tucked into the leg side
down the track and clipped down to long on, nicely timed
a big stride forward to drive and well saved by the bowler to his right
pushed through quicker and Morgan plays off the back foot, it skids on, takes the outside edge and runs fine down to the third man boundary
wide of off stump and called as so
fired in on off stump and blocked
gets down and lifts a ball on off stump over the keeper's head
quick delivery, whipped to midwicket
wide-ish and cut out hard past point but not past the cover sweeper
played with the spin behind square off the back foot
tossed up outside off and driven to long off
down the pitch, adjusts for the drag-down, back foot punch but a good save from a sliding Misbah at midwicket, good work
punched to long off on the front foot
carefully forward to block on off stump
driven out to deep cover
forward on middle and leg and defended into the leg side
tossed up, driven to long-on
length, on leg and knocked square off the pads
outside off to the lefty and defended

hit on the front pad, big stride but that won't save him! And Morgan has decided against the review. It looked like he might just have got outside the line of off stump but these marginal calls are just as likely to stay with the umpire's call in the Post DRS era. Ajmal tossed it up, Morgan missed with a crossed bat and umpire Haider raised the finger
on the stumps, defended. Men around the bat for the new man ...

and no sooner has he arrived in international cricket than he's gone! Buttler pushed tentatively at one turned towards leg, rubbed the gloves/shoulder of the bat, hit his thigh and looped high and into the hands of short leg. After just two balls, the Buttler has been served
outside off, chopped to point
on the stumps and driven to midwicket
length ball, played off the back foot into the off side
tossed up and knocked down the ground to long-on
tossed up on middle, turning and scooting away square off the outside edge
on the stumps again, defended with a slightly more authentic stroke to point
tossed up, outside off and swept via the top edge, KP reaching a long way out to cart the ball to deep backward square leg
on the stumps, driven to long-on
looping, leg-side ball that does for everybody and scuttles away for more extras
length, on the stumps, forward defensive
length ball, on off, turned square on the leg side
tossed up outside off, spinning back a long way and just missing Kieswetter's edge as he huddled in front of off stump, Adnan Akmal taking a smart catch(!)
tossed up and played back to the bowler
on the stumps, flicked through midwicket
length and Kieswetter plays a pre-meditated paddle shot over his shoulder
drops a wee bit short and Pietersen belabours a muderous back-foot drive through cover
this time he skips out to meet the ball on the full and thwack an on-drive straight at the midwicket fielder
tossed, pushed to cover
on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
big lbw appeal but umpire Haider shakes his head. It span a long way from outside off and looked to be going down leg
tossed up, drilled to cover
flighted, on the stumps, flicked straight to midwicket
flatter but Pietersen uses his feet well and punches down the ground to long-off, Ajmal failing in his half-hearted attempt to field with his feet
leg side, Pietersen can't get any bat on it
length ball, clipped to square leg
full delivery, on the stumps but Kieswetter has already set the table for this one and paddles the ball fine for another boundary
length, outside off, Pietersen backs away but too far and can't connect with an attempted late cut
worked into the leg side
flatter, on the legs and whipped away through midwicket
length, outside off and defended to cover-point
tossed up, back and driven to long-on
drops short and Kieswetter hops into position and pulls hard in the air through the vacant square leg region
and smashed through extra-cover, an awful full toss given the treatment by Pietersen
defended on the stumps
that's his fifty. He's looked in great nick again today
angled in and fizzes into the pad, the lbw shout is turned down as the ball was probably slipping down leg
tossed up and swept hard, well stopped by Junaid at midwicket
on off, driven to cover
on the stumps, tucked to square leg
drops short as Pietersen marches out of his crease again, driving to long-on
on leg, goes back and nurdles the ball into the gap square
flat delivery, punched down the ground
tossed up a bit more, on off, defends with his nose over the ball
again gives it some air, leans forward and drives to long-on for a comfortable single
full, on the stumps and timed off his pads to backward square. Actually, forget 'timed' - just off his pads
gives it some air outside off and Pietersen leans back and lofts an exquisite drive over the infield to the extra-cover boundary
looped up, turned to midwicket
on the legs and whipped away into the deep
wide of off and bottom-edged between Adnan's legs for a couple
tossed up on off and clipped down the ground
dragged down outside off, cut on the walk through point
on the stumps, glanced through square leg
drops short again, Pietersen advancing and flicking the ball through the on side with those tattooed forearms
on the stumps, worked to midwicket
around the wicket again, defensive line and tucked off the back foot to midwicket
full, floated across the right-hander and Kieswetter misses out with a late cut
looping, bouncing delivery that's hacked square, two fielders combining on the boundary to reel it in
outside off, cut to short third man
tossed up outside off stump and Pietersen watches it through
angled in and flicked to deep backward square
given some air outside off and left alone
floated up again, Kieswetter misses with a woolly swish and Adnan knocks off the bails
leg-side line from Hafeez but Pietersen reverses his grip and whips the ball square through the off side
tossed up outside off and Kieswetter plays a late dab to short third man, whose throw in is a little too exuberant for Adnan
angled across, knocked to long-off
pushed to the man at cover
on the stumps, driven down the ground
on the legs, turned to midwicket
on the stumps, driven to long-off
tossed up, defended on the front foot
blocked on the stumps again
room outside off, punched through the covers
short and Pietersen swivels quickly to hook the ball over midwicket
googly, spinning back in from outside off, inside-edged on to the pads
full, fighted, worked off the front foot out to long-on
still around the wicket, drops short, Pietersen plays it with his pads some way down the pitch after missing with a glance
leg stump, worked wide of midwicket
length, tight line, whipped to the midwicket man
tossed up on the stumps and played late, deflecting the ball to short third man
length, worked down to long-on
outside off and chopped through point
length, driven through the off side
fuller ball, on the stumps, hacked into the leg side
tossed up and worked busily to leg for another single
shorter, played off the back foot to point
short and wide again and this time cut hard to the cover sweeper
leg stump, worked away
short, pulled powerfully into the gap past midwicket
drops short, played into the on side
turned off the legs straight to backward square leg
full delivery on the stumps, driven to midwicket
flatter, goes back and chops to the same area
tossed up outside off, glanced to short third man who fields swiftly
on the stumps, worked into the midwicket area
flatter, on leg stump and defended on to the wicket
given some air outside off and Pietersen rocks back to cut
flatter but Kieswetter doesn't properly connect with his pull out to deep midwicket
wheels away on a leg-stump line and drilled to midwicket
floated up outside off and driven, reaching forward, beating the attempts of cover
fuller length, clipped square on the leg side
leg-stump line, played off the back foot to midwicket
dropped short on the leg side, but the throw to the bowler is wild and gifts England an overthrow
driven to midwicket where Misbah makes a diving stop
outside leg and defended on the back foot
straight away out lbw but reviewed and Pietersen is outside the line so survives. Goodness me it was an awful shot, trying to scoop over the keeper's head, managed to get himself outside the line
defended into the leg side
carefully blocked once more, this time on off stump
forward again to defended with a bent front knee
full and flicked down the ground
defended on off stump from the crease
outside off stump and blocked into the off side
full on middle and off and angled into the covers
down the pitch and punched to long on, via a half save from the bowler
hacked away on the pull down to deep backward square
much more sensible from Pietersen, down the pitch and driven to long on
length on leg stump and flicked out to deep midwicket
defended very late on off stump and ran behind square on the off side with a dab
leg stump, swept at and missed
short, pulled and missed now, Kieswetter's missed out on a couple of hittable balls here...
and now gets a good delivery that he can do nothing with but defend, forward, angled to leg
shuffles back and drives into the off side, they scamper a single  before extra cover can come in
middle and leg, dropped to midwicket and they take a run
fired in to middle and off, pushed back to the bowler
defended on off stump again
off stump and flicked down to long on
length and punched to mid off
swept hard out to deep backward square
down the track and punched again to long on
leg side wide
leg stump and pushed to square leg
outside leg again from around the wicket but once more Kieswetter fails to beat the in field, flicking to short long on
swept hard out to the deep and oh dear! A village error from Junaid Khan, he overruns the ball and gets beat by the spin off the second bounce
blocked on off stump into the covers
steps away and cracks a full ball wide of extra cover to the boundary, fine stroke
blocked into the covers from a length
defended forward
quicker ball, blocked forward again
goes to drive, gets a bottom edge back to the bowler
defended carefully again on middle and off
forward to block once more
little fuller and whipped down to long on
ran up to mid off and a they race through for a single
length, waited for and turned to leg
leg stump, a leading edge as Pietersen tries to flick to leg, safely enough alone the floor inbetween point and short third man
late cut off middle stump to short third man
dropped into the off side, Kiewsetter sent back, and excellent work from Azhar Ali runs him out, despite the full length dive, there was never a run there and Pakistan have seized their chance
full and flicked back to the bowler from off stump
played back on middle stump, dropped into the off side
similar straight, quick ball, blocked going back
flicked to leg, another sending back of the striker, once again there wasn't a run available
off the pad down the leg side, they take a leg bye
length on middle and off and nudged to midwicket
full outside off and driven down the ground to long off
length and flicked out to long leg
leg side wide, Pakistan could do without them at this stage
length and driven off an inside edge into pad
angled out past point
excellent yorker, dug out into the leg side
slower ball bouncer, Pietersen onto it and pulls over midwicket, not timed, they take a couple though

short again and this his hammered into the stands! What a huge shot, a flat six beautifully picked up over deep backward square, there was a nervy moment about whether the fielder was going to become involved, he might have done, if he was in row K
flat on the off stump and blocked from the crease
flicked out past point to the sweeper
skips down the yorks himself, inside egde into the pad into the off side
full on middle, squeezed out into the off side
dropped into the off side and there it is!! Dropped out on the off side, they take a single and Pietersen goes to a hundred from 136 balls with 8 fours and a six
cut out to the off side sweeper
blocked back to the bowler from the crease

given out I don't know why!! Oh it's lbw and there's a review and it proves to be a very poor decision, Patel was clearly outside the line and the replays confirm as such, he did get beaten by a spot of low bounce though
off the pad as it's tried to be pulled, runs into the leg side

pulled out to the deep midwicket fence, in comes the fielder, under his hands and through for four...it two minds, Rehman went for the catch, dived but was nowhere near it and probably should have tried to save four
oh dear this is becoming a match-losing couple of overs, half-way down again and powered in front of square to the straight midwicket fence
full and driven back to the bowler, a good save
shuffle in the crease and drive out to long off
slightly short and Pietersen rocks back so quickly and hammered again on the pull in front of deep midwicket, another powerful boundary
now waits and back foot punched to long off
tossed up and driven off an outside edge in the gap out to deep point the sweeper comes round to field
full, watched carefully, opened the face to short third man
short again! This is very poor bowling. Cut this time past extra cover, not quite enough power to get it to the rope and a sliding long off saves two runs
back of a length and tucked back to the bowler
just outside off, full of length and pushed to extra cover
length outside off, goes to force it away and gets a big inside edge through square leg
full toss and Pietersen tries to flay it away on the off side but only finds cover
drive out to long off
back foot flick out to the cover sweeper
goes to flick it away and gets an outside edge to extra cover
steps back and cut out to the deep square fence
Pietersen down the pitch and smashed down the ground for six, a fabulous strike, beautifully timed right over the bowler's head
length and angled into the off side
blocked out on the off side
turned with the off spin down to deep square leg
taken off a length on middle and leg and whipped out towards backward square
back of a length outside off and pushed in the gap at cover
full and driven out to deep cover
forced off the back foot to deeper mid off for a quick single
big swing from Pietersen, an inside edge to midwicket
full and driven firmly to mid off
smashed away for four...wide of off stump and excellent timing again away past extra cover
Pietersen down the track but checks his shot and blocks
nudged out on the off side from a length
strikes the pad and runs into the leg side trying to whip it away
great running, edged to short third man and Pietersen is through in a flash

down the track, edged and caught at point! So not quite to the end but that was inevitable that Pietersen would try something like that but he's outfoxed Ajmal today. He tried to go into the leg side but it's off a whirl of an edge straight to point
edged out to deep square
full and squirted away through third man for four! England have won, it was a full toss that Bresnan drove at and got a thick edge down to the boundary
